question: What is ISA (Income Share Agreement) ?
answer: With ISA, you can enroll in our course by paying absolutely nothing but once you are placed, you agree to pay us back the ISA amount in a no cost EMI format with a tenure option of 12, 18, 24 or 36 months only in the months you are earning an annual package of 5 LPA. Also, if you do not get a job of 5 LPA within 1 years of completing the course, the ISA expires. It is capped at 1 Lakh for final year students and 2 lakhs for pre final year students. Similarly the ISA is capped at 2 Lakh for freshers as well as experienced candidates. If you are fired or leave your first job within 6 months of joining the payment will get paused until you get a new job. If you complete 12 months in your first job with min guaranteed CTC, you have to pay the entire amount irrespective of your employment status after that.

question: How much % of Salary should I pay and for what duration ?
answer:
Final Year Students : You have to repay an ISA amount of Rs. 1 lakh + GST in total after you get placed by us, in the months where your salary is more than 5 LPA. The EMI amount deduction from your salary depends on the tenure opted by you when you get placed. Tenure options available are in the format of 12, 18, 24 and 36 months.

Pre Final Year Students : You have to repay an ISA amount of Rs. 2 lakh + GST in total after you get placed by us, in the months where your salary is more than 5 LPA. The EMI amount deduction from your salary depends on the tenure opted by you when you get placed. Tenure options available are in the format of 12, 18, 24 and 36 months.

Freshers : You have to repay an ISA amount of Rs. 2 lakh + GST in total after you get placed by us, in the months where your salary is more than 5 LPA. The EMI amount deduction from your salary depends on the tenure opted by you when you get placed. Tenure options available are in the format of 12, 18, 24 and 36 months.

Experienced : You have to repay an ISA amount of Rs. 2 lakh + GST in total after you get placed by us, in the months where your salary is more than 30% of your previous drawn CTC. The EMI amount deduction from your salary depends on the tenure opted by you when you get placed. Tenure options available are in the format of 12, 18, 24 and 36 months.

question: When does the ISA Repayment start ?
answer:
Final Year Students : It will come into force once you get placed with a more than 5 LPA job within 1yrs after completion of the course and post you joining the firm for your work.

Pre Final Year Students : It will come into force once you get placed with a more than 5 LPA job within 2 yrs after completion of the course and post you joining the firm for your work.

question: What happens if I don't get a job with a CTC of Rs 5 lakh ?
answer: In the rare event that you don't get a job with a CTC of Rs 5 Lakh, your repayment will not start. Your repayment will only start if you get a job > 5 LPA within 1 or 2 years of completing the course depending on your category.

question: What if I am laid off or quit my job in between ?
answer: In the unfortunate scenario of a lay off or if you voluntarily leave your first job within 6 months of joining the firm, the payment will get paused until you get a new job. If you complete 6 months in your first job with min guaranteed CTC, you have to pay the entire amount irrespective of your employment status after that.

question: What if I quit my job for Higher education ?
answer: As this would be a special case scenario, we would be deciding on the right way of approach to proceed with it on the basis of the risk analysis of your candidature. You would either have an option to clear of the entire due amount at one go or we could set up a payment plan for you as well.

question: How is the monthly amount to be paid on an ISA Calculated ?
answer: The monthly amount to be paid towards the ISA would be calculated on the basis of the EMI tenure opted by you while you get placed. You can choose from a tenure of 12, 18, 24 & 36 months. The entire ISA amount would be set on a No Cost EMI plan.

question: Do I get assistance on the right career path ?
answer: Once you are enrolled as a student with us, you get a lifetime complimentary access to Career Counsellors from our end who would assist you with deciding on a proper career path for you based on what your goals are.

question: What is a No Cost EMI?
answer: No Cost EMI means that you are required to pay no additional interest on the principal amount. In other words, it is a ZERO cost EMI where no interest would be charged.
